comments:
India has a lot of potential to grow, which is clear from the rising investments and GDP. 

It’s a great place to start and run new businesses.
How about Detivatives Trading as a business?
The potential is limitless, when young entreprenuers have such kind of resources and determination!
Yes correct said we wants a platform
Young  entrepreneurs need to go out of Box
How about healthcare digital stack?

The current thesis I have… thesis, passion, fascination, is to watch Indian startups kill it in today’s ecosystem. I hope that a lot of the companies we support will retell the Indian story, the real one, without any baggage from the past. It's our decade. 
@TheWTFund
 is India’s premier non-dilutive grant fund for emerging entrepreneurs under 25. Through the 1st Cohort (C1/24), 9 startups with 15 young founders under the age of 25, were shortlisted and these are some of the coolest ones we discovered.. 

The second cohort applications are now open: http://allthingswtf.com/wtfund

I love how 
@TheWTFund
 is giving young Indian founders the platform they deserve.

Non-dilutive grants are a game-changer, especially for emerging entrepreneurs with fresh ideas. It’s our decade to redefine the narrative!

The future belongs to India! This is the dawn of its decade and its century.

Building exceptional products is the key to India's success this century!

The last 4 times I turned on my TV, I shut ott(Netflix,Prime etc) and switched to YouTube twice, something is changing.
Thoughts?
No thoughts man…sometimes it’s okay to watch whatever you want without much thoughts
When Netflix or Prime refuse to sign your options trading documentary, but YouTube airs your podcast, it's common to switch from OTT to YouTube

Ye to kuch bhi nai hai. 

It’s been 8 months many traders have not opened zerodha because of your glitches ! 

Something is changing

Attention span simple!! 

A 10/20 mins content outwieghs a 50 min episode or a 120-180 mins movie!!

YouTube knows what you want to watch based on your web activities and it shows those content only and is personalized. As a result you end up watching YouTube.

However OTT suggestions is customised but common for all.
Similar to people switching from Zerodha to other brokers, the gap in quality is getting closed down due to competition.
Typical youtuber behaviour

Similar content on OTT in India, you will not have much there if you are not a fond of fiction, meanwhile YouTube gives us an impression of knowledge and information, we are always open to know something new, hence, YouTube gives us a lot of options.

I will give you three:

1. OTT is low quality abusive content
2. Less variety and choice

Biggest thing:

3. OTT doesn't have the social element and raw feel
